title: WHIRLING F2 / TEQUILA DOOR
description: The dialogue between you and the door to your room. It is locked unless you've paid for damages.

dialogueTree.title: Door, Room #1: "This is the door to your room."
dialogueTree.english: This is the door to your room.

Alternate1.english: This is the door to the room you *redecorated*.
Alternate1.polish: To drzwi do pokoju, w którym dokonałeś *redekoracji*.
Alternate1.belarusian: Гэта дзверы ў пакой, у якім ты зрабіў *рэдызайн*.

links.title: You: ""Good night, lieutenant.""
links.english: "Good night, lieutenant."
links.polish: „Dobranoc, poruczniku”.
links.belarusian: "Дабранач, лейтэнант".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just a moment. You had some questi..."
links.english: "Just a moment. You had some questions earlier, I believe, and, besides, we should discuss our progress on the investigation. Let's go out to the balcony."
links.polish: „Chwila. Zdaje się, że miałeś do mnie jakieś pytania, a poza tym powinniśmy omówić postępy naszego śledztwa. Wyjdźmy na balkon”.
links.belarusian: "Хвіліна. Здаецца, у цябе былі да мяне нейкія пытанні, а акрамя таго, мы мусім абмеркаваць поспехі нашага расследавання. Пойдзем на балкон".

links.title: You: ""Alright, let's go.""
links.english: "Alright, let's go."
links.polish: „Dobrze, chodźmy”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, пайшлі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just a moment. We should talk abou..."
links.english: "Just a moment. We should talk about our progress on the investigation. Let's go out to the balcony."
links.polish: „Chwila. Powinniśmy porozmawiać o postępach naszego śledztwa. Wyjdźmy na balkon”.
links.belarusian: "Момант. Мы павінны абмеркаваць прагрэс нашага расследавання. Выйдзем на балкон".

links.title: Door, Room #1: "Something about it has changed."
links.english: Something about it has changed.
links.polish: Coś się w nich zmieniło.
links.belarusian: Нешта ў іх змянілася.

links.title: You: "Try to unlock the door."
links.english: Try to unlock the door.
links.polish: Spróbuj otworzyć drzwi.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй адчыніць дзверы.

links.title: Door, Room #1: "Your key no longer turns in the loc..."
links.english: Your key no longer turns in the lock.
links.polish: Twój klucz nie przekręca się już w zamku.
links.belarusian: Твой ключ больш не паварочваецца ў замку.

links.title: Volition: "You feel uncertain, like a child wh..."
links.english: You feel uncertain, like a child who's lost his mother in the crowd.
links.polish: Czujesz się niepewnie niczym dziecko, które zgubiło w tłumie matkę.
links.belarusian: Адчуваеш сябе няўпэўнена, як дзіця, якое згубіла ў натоўпе маці.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It must be an electronic lock. You..."
links.english: "It must be an electronic lock. You will have to get Garte, the cafeteria manager, to open it first -- after you've paid for the night."
links.polish: „To jest pewnie zamek elektroniczny. Kierownik baru, Garte, musi go najpierw odblokować. Zrobi to, gdy zapłacisz za nocleg”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта, напэўна, электронны замок. Кіраўнік бара, Гартэ, павінен яго спачатку разблакаваць. Ён гэта зробіць, калі ты заплаціш за начлег".

links.title: Half Light: "Just punch the damned door. No *loc..."
links.english: Just punch the damned door. No *locks* are going to keep you out.
links.polish: Rąbnij po prostu te cholerne drzwi. Żaden *zamek* nie będzie blokował ci wejścia.
links.belarusian: Проста стукні па гэтым чортавым дзвярам. Ніякі *замок* не будзе блакаваць табе ўваход.

links.title: You: ""Right, I should go pay my debts be..."
links.english: "Right, I should go pay my debts before I can go to sleep."
links.polish: „Racja. Muszę pójść spłacić długi, zanim się położę”.
links.belarusian: "Праўда. Трэба пайсці пагасіць даўгі, перш чым легчы".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "Yes, we both need to get..."
links.english: He nods. "Yes, we both need to get proper rest tonight."
links.polish: Kiwa głową. „Tak, obaj potrzebujemy porządnego nocnego wypoczynku”.
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой. "Так, абодвум патрэбен добры начны адпачынак".

links.title: You: ""Nah, I'll get by somehow. Didn't l..."
links.english: "Nah, I'll get by somehow. Didn't like that room very much anyway."
links.polish: „Nie, jakoś sobie poradzę. I tak nie przepadałem za tym pokojem”.
links.belarusian: "Не, неяк сам справлюся. І ўсё роўна гэты пакой мне не вельмі падабаўся".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I would advise against that. It's..."
links.english: "I would advise against that. It's already late, and you won't find cheaper accommodation in the vicinity."
links.polish: „Nie radziłbym tego. Jest już późno, a poza tym nie znajdziesz w tej okolicy tańszego noclegu”.
links.belarusian: "Я б гэтага не раіў. Ужо позна, а акрамя таго, у гэтым раёне ты не знойдзеш больш таннага начлегу".

links.title: You: ""Actually, I don't need to pay -- I..."
links.english: "Actually, I don't need to pay -- I will brave the streets. Go undercover as a hobocop."
links.polish: „Właściwie to nie muszę płacić. Poradzę sobie na ulicy. Będę działał pod przykrywką żulicjanta”.
links.belarusian: "Вось толькі я не мушу плаціць. Справімся на вуліцы. Буду працаваць пад прыкрыццём бамжыцянта".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our investigation does not at pres..."
links.english: "Our investigation does not at present require for anyone to go undercover. Let's drop this discussion and go settle your debt with the manager."
links.polish: „Obecnie nasze śledztwo nie wymaga pracy pod przykrywką. Skończmy ten temat i udajmy się do kierownika, aby spłacić twój dług”.
links.belarusian: "Цяпер наша расследаванне не патрабуе працы пад прыкрыццём. Закончым гэтую тэму і накіруемся да кіраўніка, каб пагасіць твой доўг".

links.title: Authority: "He's asserting his leadership talen..."
links.english: He's asserting his leadership talents because he is concerned about you.
links.polish: Wykorzystuje swój przywódczy talent, bo się o ciebie martwi.
links.belarusian: Ён выкарыстоўвае свой лідарскі талент, таму што турбуецца пра цябе.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Hey, remember that trash bin idea....."
links.english: Hey, remember that trash bin idea...? Time to get climbing!
links.polish: Hej, pamiętasz ten pomysł z pojemnikiem na śmieci? Czas się tam zapakować!
links.belarusian: Прывітанне, памятаеш тую ідэю з кантэйнерам для смецця? Час там запакавана!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You could try climbing into that tr..."
links.english: You could try climbing into that trash bin in the yard, hobocop style...
links.polish: Mógłbyś spróbować wejść do tego pojemnika na śmieci na podwórzu, niczym żulicjant...
links.belarusian: Магчыма, ты мог бы паспрабаваць увайсці ў гэты смеццевы кантэйнер на двары, як нейкі жабрак...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You could try climbing into that tr..."
links.english: You could try climbing into that trash bin in the yard, hobocop style... after you've gotten open the lid.
links.polish: Mógłbyś spróbować wejść do tego pojemnika na śmieci na podwórzu, niczym żulicjant... Pod warunkiem, że otworzyłbyś pokrywę.
links.belarusian: Мог бы паспрабаваць увайсці ў гэты кантэйнер для смецця на двары, як сапраўдны бомж-паліцэйскі... Пры ўмове, што адчыніў бы вечка.

links.title: You: "Punch the door."
links.english: Punch the door.
links.polish: Uderz w drzwi.
links.belarusian: Стукай у дзверы.

links.title: Door, Room #1: "The door rings from the impact, but..."
links.english: The door rings from the impact, but does not budge.
links.polish: Drzwi trzeszczą przy uderzeniu, lecz ani drgną.
links.belarusian: Дзверы рыпаюць пры ўдары, але нават не зварухнуцца.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "(His voice echoes from downstairs.)..."
links.english: (His voice echoes from downstairs.) "What the hell is going on up there?"
links.polish: (Jego głos dobiega z dołu). „Co się tam dzieje, do cholery?”
links.belarusian: (Яго голас даносіцца знізу). "Што там адбываецца, халера на яго?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you with a..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks at you with a mixture of pity and weariness. "Come on, let's go down."
links.polish: Porucznik przygląda się ci z politowaniem i zmęczeniem. „Wystarczy. Chodźmy na dół”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант з пагардай і стомленасцю глядзіць на цябе. "Досыць. Пайдзём уніз".

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Your fist bounces off the door and..."
links.english: Your fist bounces off the door and comes back to you on a wave of agony that surges up your arm.
links.polish: Twoja pięść odbija się od drzwi i wraca ku tobie na fali przebiegającego ci po całym ramieniu bólu.
links.belarusian: Твой кулак адбіваецца ад дзвярэй і вяртаецца да цябе на хвалі болю, які прабягае па ўсёй руцэ.

links.title: You: ""Aaaaa! It huuurts!""
links.english: "Aaaaa! It huuurts!"
links.polish: „Aaaa! Boli!”
links.belarusian: "Аааа! Баліць!"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Your angry voice carries through th..."
links.english: Your angry voice carries through the Whirling, but you still can't stop the tears from welling up in your eyes...
links.polish: Twój gniewny głos niesie się po Whirling, nie jesteś jednak w stanie powstrzymać nabiegających ci do oczu łez...
links.belarusian: Твой гнеўны голас разносіцца па Whirling, але ты не ў стане стрымаць слёзы, якія набягаюць табе на вочы...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "(His voice echoes from downstairs.)..."
links.english: (His voice echoes from downstairs.) "What the hell is going on up there?"
links.polish: (Jego głos dobiega z dołu). „Co się tam dzieje, do cholery?”
links.belarusian: (Яго голас даносіцца знізу). "Што там адбываецца, халера?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you with a..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks at you with a mixture of pity and weariness. "Come on, let's go down."
links.polish: Porucznik przygląda się ci z politowaniem i zmęczeniem. „Wystarczy. Chodźmy na dół”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе з жалем і стомленасцю. "Досыць. Пойдзем уніз".

links.title: You: "Keep it in. Cradle your arm."
links.english: Keep it in. Cradle your arm.
links.polish: Zduś to w sobie. Złap się za rękę.
links.belarusian: Задушы гэта ў сабе. Схапіся за руку.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "The tears bring some relief, but no..."
links.english: The tears bring some relief, but not much.
links.polish: Łzy przynoszą ulgę, choć nie jest jej wiele.
links.belarusian: Слёзы прыносяць палёгку, хоць яе і няшмат.

links.title: You: "Try to stay cool."
links.english: Try to stay cool.
links.polish: Spróbuj zachować spokój.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй захаваць спакой.

links.title: Composure: "You've got this. Men like you don't..."
links.english: You've got this. Men like you don't cry unless it serves their purposes.
links.polish: Dasz radę. Faceci tacy jak ty nie płaczą, o ile nie służy to ich celom.
links.belarusian: Ты справішся. Такія хлопцы, як ты, не плачуць, калі гэта не служыць іх мэтам.

links.title: You: "Confront the door with a stoical ex..."
links.english: Confront the door with a stoical expression. You are still The Law.
links.polish: Stań przeciw drzwiom ze stoickim wyrazem twarzy. Wciąż jesteś prawem.
links.belarusian: Стань супраць дзвярэй з стаічным выразам твару. Ты ўсё яшчэ з’яўляешся законам.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "(His voice echoes from downstairs.)..."
links.english: (His voice echoes from downstairs.) "What's going on up there?"
links.polish: (Jego głos dobiega z dołu). „Co się tam dzieje?”
links.belarusian: (Яго голас даносіцца знізу). "Што там адбываецца?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods toward the staircase. "Come..."
links.english: He nods toward the staircase. "Come on, let's go down."
links.polish: Kiwa głową w kierunku schodów. „No już, chodźmy na dół”.
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой у бок лесвіцы. "Ну ўжо, хадзем унiз".

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Nice try. The tears come streaming..."
links.english: Nice try. The tears come streaming down your face as you crumble to the ground.
links.polish: Nie wyszło. Padasz na ziemię z twarzą zalaną łzami.
links.belarusian: Не атрымалася. Ты падаеш на зямлю з тварам, залітым слязьмі.

links.title: You: "Blubber. And keep blubbering."
links.english: Blubber. And keep blubbering.
links.polish: Bełkocz. Nie przestawaj bełkotać.
links.belarusian: Бурмочы. Не спыняй бурчаць.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It hurts, but keep your cool. You'v..."
links.english: It hurts, but keep your cool. You've got this.
links.polish: Boli, ale ty zachowujesz spokój. Dasz radę.
links.belarusian: Баліць, але ты захоўваеш спакой. Ты справішся.

links.title: You: "Try one more time. This time with b..."
links.english: Try one more time. This time with both fists, one after the other.
links.polish: Spróbuj jeszcze raz. Tym razem obiema pięściami, jedną po drugiej.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй яшчэ раз. Гэтым разам абедзьвюма кулакамі, адзін за адным.

links.title: Door, Room #1: "The door shudders, but appears unda..."
links.english: The door shudders, but appears undamaged.
links.polish: Drzwi drżą, lecz wydają się nienaruszone.
links.belarusian: Дзверы трасуцца, але здаюцца некранутымі.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Pow-pow! That was impressive."
links.english: Pow-pow! That was impressive.
links.polish: Bang, bang! Imponujące.
links.belarusian: Бэнг, бэнг! Уражваюча.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "(His voice echoes from downstairs.)..."
links.english: (His voice echoes from downstairs.) "What's going on up there?"
links.polish: (Jego głos dobiega z dołu). „Co się tam dzieje?”
links.belarusian: (Яго голас долятае знізу). "Што там адбываецца?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant purses his lips. "Ad..."
links.english: The lieutenant purses his lips. "Admirable form. Now come on, let's go down."
links.polish: Porucznik zaciska usta. „Forma godna podziwu. Ale lepiej chodźmy na dół”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант з сціснутымі вуснамі. "Форма годная захаплення. Але лепш пайшлі ўніз".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks on impassively..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks on impassively. "Even if you could break down the door, all you would get is another bill."
links.polish: Porucznik przygląda się ci beznamiętnie. „Nawet jeśli udałoby ci się wyłamać te drzwi, to zyskałbyś dzięki temu jedynie dodatkowy rachunek”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе безэмоцыйна. "Нават калі б табе ўдалося выбіць гэтыя дзверы, ты б атрымаў толькі дадатковы рахунак".

links.title: Door, Room #1: "The door appears undamaged, and eve..."
links.english: The door appears undamaged, and even more impassive than the lieutenant.
links.polish: Drzwi wydają się nienaruszone i jeszcze bardziej beznamiętne niż porucznik.
links.belarusian: Дзверы здаюцца некранутымі і яшчэ больш абыякавымі, чым лейтэнант.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "*Even if you could*? Don't let him..."
links.english: *Even if you could*? Don't let him talk you down, son!
links.polish: *Nawet jeśliby ci się udało*? Nie pozwól się traktować z góry, synku!
links.belarusian: *Нават калі б табе ўдалося*? Не дазваляй, каб з табой абыходзіліся звысоку, сынку!

links.title: You: ""This door will fall prostrate befo..."
links.english: "This door will fall prostrate before The Law!" (Punch the door again.)
links.polish: „Te drzwi padną plackiem przed obliczem prawa!” (Uderz w drzwi raz jeszcze).
links.belarusian: "Гэтыя дзверы ўпаўдуць перад абліччам закона!" (Удары па дзвярах яшчэ раз).

links.title: You: "Observe the damage to your knuckles..."
links.english: Observe the damage to your knuckles. Is this really worth it?
links.polish: Przyjrzyj się swoim poobijanym knykciom. To naprawdę tego warte?
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на свае пабітыя суставы. Ці сапраўды гэта таго варта?

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "The door to your room locks every n..."
links.english: The door to your room locks every night at 21.00 if you haven't paid for the room. You can pay downstairs when speaking to Garte, the cafeteria manager.
links.polish: Drzwi do twojego pokoju zamykają się co wieczór o 21:00, o ile za niego nie zapłacisz. Możesz to zrobić na dole, rozmawiając z Garte'em, kierownikiem baru.
links.belarusian: Дзверы ў ваш пакой зачыняюцца кожны вечар а 21:00, калі толькі вы не заплаціце за яго. Вы можаце зрабіць гэта ўнізе, пагутарыўшы з Гартэ, мэнэджарам бара.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Сыходзь].
